source.name: Proof of Stake Consensus Mechanism
source.instructions: Which of the following statements best describes the Proof of Stake (PoS) consensus mechanism in blockchain networks?

answers.answer: A system where participants with the largest coin holdings have the highest chance of validating transactions and creating new blocks
A method where miners compete to solve complex mathematical puzzles to add new blocks to the blockchain
A protocol that requires all network participants to agree unanimously before any transaction can be processed
A technique where transaction validation is performed by a small group of pre-selected, trusted nodes

source.guidance: The correct answer is "A system where participants with the largest coin holdings have the highest chance of validating transactions and creating new blocks". This accurately describes the Proof of Stake mechanism, where the likelihood of being chosen to validate transactions and create new blocks is proportional to the amount of cryptocurrency a participant holds and "stakes". The other options are incorrect because: the second option describes Proof of Work, not Proof of Stake; the third option describes an impractical consensus method that would severely limit blockchain efficiency; and the fourth option more closely resembles a permissioned blockchain system, which is different from the PoS mechanism used in public blockchains.
source.learningObjectives: SWBAT compare and contrast the key features of Proof of Stake (PoS) consensus mechanism with other blockchain consensus mechanisms
